column5: BHC Legit question would it be better to have more cash on hand then to pay down debt Right now I assume they have around 1 billion on hand and debt is around 24 billion so that is a 124 cash to debt ratio if they were to save another billion then we are talking about a 112 cash to debt ratio add another billion and we are at a 16 cash to debt ratio Many pharma companies have debt but I think when it comes down to valuation many might view a higher debt ratio as being worse than the debt itself Im curious on other people thoughts here
